routine.activity: Warm up with cardio machine of your choice
audio: Ready to start your lower body strength workout? Let's begin with a warm-up on your favorite cardio machine
Choose a rower, bike or even go for a run
Get ready to move!

routine.title: Dynamic Stretching & Movement Prep
audio: Moving onto the warm up
There will be 3 sets of 4 warm ups to activate muscles for squats.
First up is the world greatest stretch
Step one foot forward into a lunge position
Place both hands on the ground inside your front foot
Rotate your torso and reach your arm up towards the ceiling
Hold for a moment, then return your hand to the ground
Step back to the starting position and repeat on the other side

activity.activity: One and a Quarter Air Squat
audio: Next we have the one and a quarter air squat
Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart
Lower into a squat position, going as low as you can while keeping your chest up
Rise back up halfway, then lower back down into the squat
Finally, stand all the way up to complete one rep
Now let's do the 90/90 ER hinge
Sit on the ground with one leg bent in front of you at a 90-degree angle and the other leg bent behind you also at a 90-degree angle
Place your hands on your hips and engage your core
Hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back straight and chest up
Return to the starting position and repeat on the other side
Finally, we have the glute bridge
Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the ground, hip-width apart
Place your arms at your sides with palms facing down
Engage your core and squeeze your glutes as you lift your hips towards the ceiling
Hold for a moment at the top, then slowly lower your hips back down to the starting position
Now we are ready for back squats
Set up under the bar with it resting on your upper traps
Keep your chest up and core engaged as you descend into the squat
Drive through your heels to return to standing
Let's get started with 4 sets of 5 reps
